title: 'Mowgli' girl, 12, who 'barks and howls' was 'traded to paedophiles for vodka'

A "Mowgli" girl who "barks and howls" was traded to paedophiles by her mother in exchange for vodka, it is claimed.

The 12-year-old girl called Diana was found after escaping her cage and walking on all fours “like a frightened animal” in the street.

The child makes barking noises instead of talking, is unable to walk standing up on two feet, sleeps on the floor and looks half her age, according to reports.

It is claimed the girl's mother forced her to live in a cage at times and in a dilapidated shed with a cow during the summer months.

(Image: Oryol Times/east2west news)

The mother-of-eight has denied the claims and police are now investigating the disturbing allegations of abuse and neglect.

The child is suffering from “exhaustion” and being treated in hospital following her escape in the Russian city of Oryol.

A hospital source told the Oryol Times: “The mother is an alcoholic. This is her eighth child.

“The previous seven were taken away by the guardianship authorities.

(Image: Tatiana Sinelnikova KP/east2west news)

“The mother hid this child in every possible way.

“At home - she was kept in a cage, and if she had to go somewhere, carried her a bag on wheels.

“For a bottle of vodka, she sold the girl into sexual slavery.”

Police intervened and the child was removed from her mother, Madina, 38, and she is now receiving help, said senior hospital physician Lyudmila Krylova.

(Image: Tatiana Sinelnikova KP/east2west news)

The mother, from the Chechnya region, has not been charged with a crime.

She and neighbours denied the sexual slavery claims.

She told REN TV that claims she had traded her daughter to paedophiles for vodka was “bulls***”.

Madina has claimed the child was “sick” and there was “nothing she could do about it”.

(Image: Tatiana Sinelnikova KP/east2west news)

Russian media showed images of girl curled up in a ball in hospital and the shed where she was allegedly forced to live.

The girl’s father, from Belarus, died earlier this year.

There were claims that Diana had been "disabled since birth".

A criminal case into alleged negligence has been launched against child care officials who were accused of failing to protect Diana.

The Komsomolskaya Pravda newspaper, citing neighbours, claimed: “The mother locked the girl in the room only during the cold weather.

(Image: east2west news)

“In summer, she kept her in a small paddock next to the cattle.”

It is believed dogs, ducks and hens were also around the girl at the family smallholding in the village of Luka Zhuravinka, near Oryol.

Reports say the girl sleeps only on the floor and cannot use cutlery.

The disturbing case was leaked to the local media after the child was admitted to hospital.

One hospital source said Diana refuses to sleep in a bed.

“She constantly slides to the floor and hides in a corner, curling up in a ball.”

She “pounces on food, swallows quickly, spits it up, and again tries to eat.

“The sight is not for the faint-hearted.”
description: The 12-year-old girl - allegedly forced to live in a cage and cattle shed, walks on all fours and cannot talk - was “like a frightened animal” when she was finally rescued in Oryol, Russia
